title: Absolutely Ultimate Potato Soup
description: This creamy, comforting potato soup is the perfect hearty meal for chilly days. Rich with smoky bacon, tender potatoes, and a luscious herb-infused cream base, it’s a soul-warming treat that’s easy to make and endlessly satisfying.
ingredients: 4 cups chicken stock, or enough to cover potatoes
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Place bacon in a Dutch oven and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, 5 to 10 minutes.
Drain bacon pieces on paper towels and reserve 1/4 cup of the bacon grease in the pot; discard the rest.
Cook celery and onion in the reserved bacon drippings until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir in garlic and cook for 1 to 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add cubed potatoes and toss to coat, sautéing for 3 to 4 minutes.
Return bacon to the pot and add enough chicken stock to just cover the potatoes.
Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 15 to 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, melt butter in a separate skillet over medium heat and whisk in flour.
Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 to 2 minutes to form a roux.
Slowly whisk in heavy cream, dried tarragon, and chopped cilantro.
Bring the cream mixture to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Add the cream mixture to the potato mixture and stir to combine.
Transfer about half of the soup to a blender and purée until smooth, then return to the Dutch oven.
Adjust salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, optionally topped with crumbled bacon, green onions, or shredded Cheddar cheese.
tips: For a bacon-free version, substitute 1/4 cup melted butter for the bacon grease to maintain richness. When blending, be careful with hot liquids—blend in batches and vent the lid slightly to avoid splatters. Use Yukon Gold potatoes for a creamier texture. Fresh herbs brighten the soup, so add them just before serving if possible.

structured_content.content: This potato soup is a creamy, savory delight that warms you from the inside out. The smoky aroma of bacon mingles with tender potatoes and fresh herbs, creating a bowl that’s both rustic and refined. It’s the kind of dish that invites you to slow down and savor every comforting spoonful.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 45 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for cold winter days, weeknight dinners, or casual entertaining
  • Uses simple, accessible ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Rich, creamy texture with a perfect balance of smoky and fresh herb notes

structured_content.content: I’ve made this soup countless times for family and friends, and it never fails to impress. One winter evening, serving this soup after a snowy day brought everyone together around the table, sharing stories and laughter. It’s more than just a meal—it’s a cozy experience.

• Main ingredient: Yukon Gold or Russet potatoes work best for their creamy texture and ability to hold shape when cooked.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Bacon provides smoky depth, while dried tarragon and fresh cilantro add bright herbal notes—choose fresh herbs for the best flavor.
  • Supporting ingredients: Celery and onion build a savory base, garlic adds warmth, and heavy cream creates a luscious finish.
  • Equipment needed: A Dutch oven or heavy pot for even cooking, a blender for puréeing, and a separate skillet for the roux.

Preparation:
Chop bacon, dice celery and onion, mince garlic, peel and cube potatoes. This prep ensures smooth cooking flow.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Cook bacon until crisp, then use the rendered fat to sauté vegetables. Add potatoes and stock, simmer until tender. Meanwhile, make a roux with butter and flour, whisk in cream and herbs, then thicken. Combine all and purée half for creamy texture.
Finishing Touches:
Adjust seasoning, garnish with extra bacon, green onions, or cheese for added flavor and texture. Serve piping hot for maximum comfort.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Maintain medium heat when cooking bacon to avoid burning and ensure even crispness.
  • Don’t discard all bacon grease—reserve 1/4 cup for sautéing vegetables to infuse flavor.
  • Potatoes are done when easily pierced with a fork but not falling apart.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container refrigerated up to 3 days; reheat gently to avoid curdling.

structured_content.content: Sharing this soup with loved ones always brings a sense of warmth and togetherness. It’s a dish that feels like a hug in a bowl, perfect for creating lasting memories around the dinner table.

Enhance the soup with a sprinkle of smoked paprika for extra smokiness or a dash of cayenne for subtle heat. Fresh chives or parsley add a bright finish. For a richer taste, swirl in a spoonful of sour cream or crème fraîche just before serving.

Pair this soup with crusty artisan bread or a fresh green salad for a balanced meal. It also pairs beautifully with a crisp white wine or a warm spiced cider, making it ideal for cozy dinners or casual gatherings.

For a vegetarian version, omit bacon and use vegetable broth with 1/4 cup melted butter instead of bacon grease. Swap heavy cream for coconut milk to make it dairy-free, and add smoked paprika to mimic smoky flavor. For a vegan twist, use plant-based cream and skip the cheese toppings.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Cook bacon slowly over medium heat for perfect crispness without burning.
  • Whisk the roux constantly to prevent lumps and achieve a silky cream base.
  • Blend half the soup to keep a pleasing mix of creamy and chunky textures.
  • Garnish with colorful toppings like green onions and cheddar for visual appeal.

structured_content.content: Don’t be intimidated by making soup from scratch—this recipe is straightforward and rewarding. With each spoonful, you’ll feel proud of creating a delicious, comforting dish that brings joy and warmth to your table. Happy cooking!
